item.title: Student allegedly raped by Hobart teacher in 1980s disclosed concerns, court told
item.description: A student who was allegedly raped by a Hobart teacher in the 1980s was told to focus on her studies after raising concerns with the teacher's behaviour, a court has heard.

item.title: Pentagon reportedly asked to probe SpaceX for potential Chinese ownership seen as a 'national security threat'
item.description: Chinese investment in Elon Musk's company SpaceX has been cited as a "national security threat", according to senators Elizabeth Warren and Andy Kim.

item.title: AACTA 2026 winners list: Gory horror wins best film, Jacob Elordi drama dominates TV
item.description: Directors Danny and Michael Philippou clean up at the 2026 AACTA awards, taking home 10 statues for their chilling horror film Bring Her Back.

item.title: TC Mitchell set to become severe category 3 system off WA's Pilbara coast
item.description: Residents along WA's Pilbara coast have been warned to prepare to shelter as Cyclone Mitchell builds into a severe category 3 system.

item.title: Daisy Thomas, competing without an ACL, suffers heavy crash at Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Australian freestyle skier Daisy Thomas, who is competing at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games without an ACL, suffers a heavy fall in slopestyle training and has withdrawn from the event to focus on big air.

item.title: Budget reform is back as Labor shapes second term agenda
item.description: As the opposition and government wrestled in the hay barn over who's to blame for this week's Reserve Bank interest rate increase, there's a much bigger story unfolding in the wings.

item.title: 'Another world is possible': Calls for unity at Winter Olympics opening
item.description: The 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics are here, launched in an historic opening ceremony held in a number of Italian locations simultaneously.

item.title: Former ambassador Ian Kemish writes about Europe's 'forgotten' war in debut novel Two Islands
item.description: Former ambassador Ian Kemish draws on his 25-year diplomatic career in his debut novel, Two Islands, set against the backdrop of the Balkan War.

item.title: Elders say truth-telling 'critical' to combatting racism after alleged terror attack
item.description: For Noongar Elders, the alleged attack on Boorloo/Perth is viewed against the background of a long history of violence. They are calling for a truth-telling commission to heal deep scars and help to combat racism.

item.title: Inside the 'textbook' search for Gus Lamont
item.description: A retired police officer who helped pioneer search guidelines used during the investigation into the disappearance of Gus Lamont, praises the efforts to find the missing boy and expresses support for the detectives' conclusions.

item.title: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, India's 14-year-old batting prodigy, breaks records in Under-19 World Cup final
item.description: The 14-year-old prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi breaks Alyssa Healy's record with the highest score ever in a World Cup final to power India to the global under-19 crown.

item.title: Adelaide Festival leader Julian Hobba reflects on Writers' Week controversy
item.description: As Adelaide Writers' Week went up in flames, Julian Hobba contemplated resigning as Adelaide Festival's executive director. He now says "we needed to trust the judgement" of the literary event's former leader, Louise Adler.

item.title: Collision sport Run Nation Championship in Sydney sells 5,000 tickets despite head injury concerns
item.description: The Run Nation Championship will see two athletes run at each other, in a sport criticised for its head injury risks. Organisers argue the championship has been professionalised, and will grow to be as big as boxing.

item.title: Golden bandicoot numbers triple at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary in Central Australia
item.description: A population of threatened golden bandicoots is booming at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, north-west of Alice Springs.

item.title: Meringandan collector sells vintage tractors, trucks, machines on Queensland farm
item.description: As the last man standing, 78-year-old cattleman Mervyn has parted with his collection of tractors and utes, pledging his estate to charity.

item.title: Epstein files reaffirm even a conviction doesn't taint 'good bloke' status
item.description: The rich and powerful were all too happy to stay connected to Jeffrey Epstein until it became the less convenient option.

item.title: ‘Absolutely horrified’: Community left in the dark about PFAS contamination
item.description: For 25 years this waterway was polluted with toxic "forever chemicals". It was only disconnected from a major drinking supply 18 months ago.

item.description: Australia is taking its strongest ever team to the Winter Olympics in 2026, with a number of genuine medal chances. Here's a handful of the stars you need to pay attention to.

item.title: Nancy Guthrie may have been abducted in a 41-minute window, authorities say
item.description: Nancy Guthrie was last seen alive when a relative dropped her outside her Tucson home after a family games night. The 84-year-old grandmother has now been missing for a week.

item.title: What is the AIN at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics? Why Russian and Belarusian athletes are allowed to compete in Italy
item.description: The Winter Olympics of Milano Cortina 2026 is another where Russian and Belarusian athletes will be largely absent, although there are a handful competing as individual neutral athletes.

item.description: One of Sanae Takaichi's first engagements after she was elevated to prime minister in October was to host Donald Trump in Tokyo.

item.description: Athletes parade across Italy, Mariah Carey ignites a historic evening, and 'Coach Snoop' makes an appearance at the curling. Here are the quick hits from the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics opening ceremony.

item.title: A 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony message of harmony and peace, rammed into a world of division
item.description: As the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics Opening ceremony pleads a message of peace, the world outside the Olympic bubble burns.

item.title: Woman was asleep when car crashed into house in Perth suburb of Rivervale, killing her
item.description: A woman who had been in Perth to visit family was asleep when a car crashed into an inner-city home, killing her, late on Friday night.

item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan today.

item.title: Accused militant in deadly 2012 Benghazi attack on US compound taken into custody in United States
item.description: Zubayar Al-Bakoush, 58, has been wanted by the United States for more than a decade for his alleged role in the attack, which killed four Americans, including the US ambassador to Libya.

item.title: Police given additional powers as NSW premier calls for calm during Israeli presidential visit
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns has told demonstrators planning to protest Israel President Isaac Herzog's visit to Sydney that there should be "no clashes or violence".

item.title: The Mark of Cain lead singer on a lifetime masking the truth
item.description: The lead singer of legendary Adelaide rockers The Mark of Cain this week announced she was transgender, but it comes after nearly 60 years of hiding the truth from everyone.

item.title: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley face big distances to hospital and high rates of heart condition, diabetes
item.description: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley experience high rates of preventable health conditions, hours of travel to receive basic care and limited support.

item.title: Thailand election stakes are high as progressives mount new challenge against establishment
item.description: As Thailand prepares to head to the polls, voters remain wary that in their version of democracy, the party they vote for is not always the one that takes power.

item.title: Report finds two thirds of tip-offs about children in harm in NSW not investigated
item.description: In one uninvestigated case a man was convicted of sexually abusing a minor a year after an uninvestigated report was made to the department.

item.title: Latest Epstein files documents reveal links to multiple monarchies
item.description: The latest release of the so-called Epstein files has revealed the convicted child sex offender was in contact with members of — and people close to — monarchies across Europe and the Middle East.

item.description: Teeth are one of the most visible markers of poverty: structural circumstances that are individually borne.

item.description: Australia's Valentino Guseli falls short of reaching the podium in the men's snowboard big air final on day one of the Milano Cortino Winter Olympics.

item.description: A permission structure has been crafted for Liberals to ditch the first woman to lead the federal party room before she has even had a year in the role.

item.description: From rare cancers caught early to dementia foretold decades in advance, newborn genomic testing raises an unsettling question: Just because we can know, should we?

item.description: Xavier Rudd performs solo these days, but he carries a spirit with him wherever he goes.

item.title: Big swings in Australia's electricity market have a frustrating effect on our power bills
item.description: The benefits of extremely low energy prices during the day are "washed away" by extremely high ones after dark. But there is light at the end of the tunnel.

item.description: Bangladesh is heading back to the ballot box in what is being billed as its first free and fair election in more than a decade.

item.description: For a show that lasts roughly 13 minutes, the Super Bowl half-time performance has fuelled decades of conversation.

item.description: Australia makes a hot start to the Rugby Sevens in Perth, with both the men's and women's teams going unbeaten in securing semifinal berths.

item.description: The barking of a dog kicks off a marathon medical effort that ends in a rare lifesaving surgery at a remote hospital.

item.title: United States send India a T20 World Cup scare before Suryakumar Yadav settles hosts
item.description: India is briefly left reeling at 6-67 against an underdog United States team, but captain Suryakumar Yadav helps the hosts avoid a horror start at the T20 World Cup.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Mitchell continues to hit the Pilbara as Karratha residents start cleanup
item.description: Onslow, Exmouth and Coral Bay remain in the firing line, while an emergency warning for Karratha has been lifted, as Tropical Cyclone Mitchell continues to track along the Pilbara coast.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 day one quick hits: Mariah Carey accused of lip-syncing, Eileen Gu channels inner 'nerd'
item.description: A Finnish skier makes a questionable fashion choice on the slopes, while Mariah Carey faces claims she was lip-syncing at the opening ceremony. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Seasonal Australian produce to make the most of in February
item.description: From grapes to red capsicum, here's how to prioritise some of this season's best fruit and veg.

item.title: Tasmania looks at allowing public hospital midwives to help with homebirths
item.description: The Tasmanian government is developing a public homebirth model that would allow midwives working in the public system to support women to labour from their homes.

item.title: How a Canberra-based refugee fled the Maduro regime along with millions of other Venezuelans
item.description: Josh Madrid was arrested for attending a pro-democracy protest in Venezuela. 24 hours later, he fled his homeland, fearing he would be killed by the government.

item.title: New hope for national gun register 30 years after it was first proposed
item.description: First proposed after the Port Arthur massacre in 1996, Australia still doesn't have a national gun register. As Queensland parliament sits for the first time since national gun reforms became law, advocates say it is time to centralise firearm information.

item.title: Heat and fires expose ancestral remains in Victoria's north-west
item.description: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

item.title: Man arrested after suspicious Maidstone church fire
item.description: A man is due to be questioned by police after a church in Melbourne's west caught fire in the early hours of this morning.

item.title: Before opening Meg's Bookshop in 1991, the Arnolds were told kids 'didn't read' in Port Pirie
item.description: In one of Australia's most disadvantaged regions, more known for its lead than its literature, a couple wanted to open a book store but were told children didn't read books there. They did it anyway, and it went on to become a "world class" institution.

item.title: Valentino Guseli missed out on a bonus 2026 Winter Olympics medal, but won something even more important
item.description: It was 18 months ago that Valentino Guseli blew out his ACL attempting a backside 1800 at the Beijing big air. At the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard big air final, he put that ghost to rest.

item.title: New Hobart zip-line proposal for public land, but this one wouldn't be on Kunanyi/Mount Wellington
item.description: Another zip-line is being proposed for public land near Hobart, almost a year after the last proposal on Kunanyi/Mt Wellington was knocked back by the Hobart City Council.

item.title: 3 Doors Down frontman Brad Arnold dies after stage four cancer battle
item.description: Brad Arnold, a founder and the lead singer of American rock band 3 Doors Down, dies nine months after revealing he had kidney cancer.

item.title: Train delays in Italy during Winter Olympics opening weekend after damage
item.description: Police are investigating three incidents of damage on lines around Bologna, and have not ruled out a potential link to the Milan Cortina Games.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie indicates she will pay ransom for return of her mother in video message to apparent kidnappers
item.description: In a video posted to Instagram, the host of NBC's Today Show appears to directly address her mother's kidnappers, telling them she and her siblings have "received your message, and we understand".

item.title: Equine photography in demand in Australian performance horse industry
item.description: From leaf blowers to dance moves, photographers use every trick they can think of to get the perfect shot for the biggest performance-horse sale in the southern hemisphere.

item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan today.

item.title: Why young people say they are not the only ones hooked on screens
item.description: The focus of discussion around screen time is on teenagers and young adults, but young people say they are noticing older people are in the grips of their devices too.

item.title: Man dead, five others hospitalised after Sydney's Dreamstate music festival
item.description: Several people suffered "medical episodes" at the trance music festival at Sydney's Olympic Park, according to police.

item.title: Piper James's parents say dingo management reform needed to prevent further deaths on K'gari
item.description: Piper James's parents are leaving Australia with their daughter's ashes and a determination to ensure she hasn't died in vain.

item.title: Palestine Action Group takes court action against extra police powers ahead of protests against Israeli president's Sydney visit
item.description: The Palestine Action Group lodged submissions late on Sunday afternoon, arguing the declaration was "draconian" and imposed rules unsuitable for protest activity.

item.title: Search effort winds down for missing Gold Coast fisherman
item.description: The cross-border search for a 44-year-old fisherman missing off the Gold Coast for three days has been scaled back and transitioned into a recovery phase after his boat and EPIRB were found but there were no signs of life.

item.title: Payne Haas quits Brisbane to sign three-year deal with South Sydney Rabbitohs
item.description: South Sydney have pulled off one of the biggest recruitment moves in NRL history after signing Brisbane enforcer Payne Haas to a three-year contract from 2027.

item.description: The Tasmanian government announces increased penalties for those caught selling illegal tobacco products.

item.title: WA photographers reminisce about bygone Goldfields era as gold's price surges
item.description: In 1989, two photographers travelled from Fremantle to Western Australia's Goldfields to capture the end of a gold mining era.

item.title: Police recover pilot's body from croc-infested marsh after Normanton plane crash
item.description: Police officers armed with rifles guarded their colleagues while they recovered the man's body from the crash site in difficult terrain near Normanton, in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

item.title: SA Liberals promise new stamp duty concessions, Labor tackles aged care bed backlog
item.description: Less than six weeks from the South Australian election, the Liberal Party has announced an election promise on stamp duty while the Labor government unveil its plan to create 1,300 new aged care beds.

item.title: Two Australians reach big air final after tense qualifying runs
item.description: Olympic medallist Tess Coady and fellow Australian Meila Stalker reach the snowboard big air final, after a dramatic day where American superstar Lindsey Vonn crashes in women's downhill.

item.title: Danish people using apps to help boycott American goods over Greenland
item.description: After Donald Trump's repeated threats to acquire Greenland, many Danish people felt powerless but new apps are helping them make choices to boycott US-made products.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn's horror crash at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games was always on the cards
item.description: Lindsey Vonn's shocking downhill crash at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games was always a possibility given the American was competing just nine days after rupturing her ACL. But it was never going to stop her from trying.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Mitchell downgraded to category one system
item.description: Residents are sheltering as destructive winds and heavy rain lash the tourist towns in north-west WA.

item.title: Roaring winds, dry country and rugged terrain: Why Victoria is prone to devastating bushfires
item.description: Some of the world's most destructive bushfires take place in the southern state. Its unique mix of fierce winds, high fuel loads and rugged terrain are to blame.

item.title: Telstra mobile tower sparks backlash in St Helens despite poor phone coverage
item.description: It's known for fishing boats, a pristine coast, a skyline without a high-rise in sight — and notoriously patchy phone reception. So, a new phone tower would be welcome, you'd think.

item.title: The Tasmania Devils start selling memberships later this month — how will they work?
item.description: The Tasmania Devils will start signing up members later this month, but there's some confusion about what is required to secure a seat for AFL games in 2028. Here's how it will work.

item.title: UK prime minister's chief of staff Morgan McSweeney quits amid Epstein fallout
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer's leadership is under threat after revelations that one of his former US ambassadors had close ties with Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Japan PM Sanae Takaichi leads coalition to landslide election victory
item.description: Sanae Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party and its coalition partner are expected to hold upwards of two-thirds of the seats in Japan's lower house.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds smash Jamaica again to seal three-game series in Perth
item.description: Kate Moloney celebrates her 50-game milestone in style as the Australian Diamonds post a 32-goal victory over an understrength Jamaica in Perth.

item.title: Why Payne Haas's move from Brisbane to South Sydney changes the game for two NRL giants
item.description: Payne Haas's decision to leave Brisbane for South Sydney in 2027 didn't just shock the rugby league world, it transformed the futures of two of rugby league's most powerful clubs in an instant.

item.title: Australia's women beaten by New Zealand in Perth Sevens final, but men claim bronze
item.description: The Australian women are forced to settle for silver at the Perth Sevens, while the Aussie men claim bronze in thrilling fashion.

item.title: Green turtle released from Taronga Zoo's wildlife hospital after horror injury
item.description: After surviving one of the worst fishing line injuries vet Rebecca Robey had ever seen, Terry the turtle has been set free.

item.title: Bullying surges in ACT public schools as parents, teachers speak out
item.description: Reports of bullying in ACT public schools have risen sharply in four years. Parents and teachers say children are paying the price, and the system is not coping.

item.title: Extreme heat returning for south-east Queensland before weekend showers
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting "locally severe heatwave conditions" from Tuesday, culminating in a maximum of 35 degrees in Brisbane on Thursday.

item.title: Israeli President Isaac Herzog tells Sydney event antisemitism has been 'festering' in Australia
item.description: Isaac Herzog was invited by the governor-general and prime minister to join the Jewish community grieving the loss of life in the December 14 massacre of mostly Jewish Australians at a Hanukkah event.

item.title: Mother claims missed warning signs in NT hospital led to baby's lifelong disabilities
item.description: Mia Pilbrow is taking legal action against a Northern Territory hospital and calling for the territory to adopt tailored pre-term labour guidelines, after medical staff sent her home seven times during her pregnancy, repeatedly assuring her the baby was fine.

item.title: As AFL prepares to reboot State of Origin, there are hopes it can capture the imagination of a new generation
item.description: The AFL is about to reboot the State of Origin concept, with the clash between Western Australia and Victoria at Perth Stadium next Saturday — on Valentine's Day — set to show if there's any love left for the idea.

item.description: Days away from the release of Emerald Fennell's highly anticipated adaptation of Emily Brontë's classic novel, critics and fans alike are still fighting about text fidelity in the comments.

item.title: Deua River Valley and Cobargo still rebuilding six years after Black Summer bushfires
item.description: Residents who lived through the 2019-20 bushfires on the NSW South Coast say this summer's fires triggered traumatic memories, and highlighted the recovery and resilience projects that remain unfinished.

item.title: Court appoints statutory trustee to sell rundown Rockhampton Plaza Hotel
item.description: After years of complaints from local authorities, a judge has ordered the sale of the property which sits surrounded by temporary fencing, with smashed windows and timber boards nailed across its seven-storey façade.

item.title: Kimberley cotton hits record high in first season with new processing gin in Kununurra
item.description: From farm to fabric, West Australian cotton growers are finally able to grow, process and export record amounts of cotton locally.

item.description: The Seattle Seahawks overawe the New England Patriots in Super Bowl LX as punter Michael Dickson becomes the second ever Australian NFL champion.

item.title: Tasmanian minister Nick Duigan to go on medical leave for heart surgery
item.description: Tasmanian minister Nick Duigan will take extended medical leave to undergo heart surgery, the state government has announced.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn breaks her leg, Breezy Johnson breaks her gold medal — quick hits from day two
item.description: US great Lindsey Vonn breaks her leg, and her compatriot breaks her gold medal as Tess Coady sneaks through to the final after a nervous wait on the bubble. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Cyclists slam 'nightmare' shared path at new Sydney Fish Market
item.description: The decision to put a shared bike path in front of the new Sydney Fish Market is causing a clash between commuter cyclists and visitors to the site, riders say.

item.description: A study has found increasing "punitive" bail law amendments are negatively affecting First Nations people.

item.title: Darkwaves research allows scientists to measure impact of 'underwater blackouts' on marine life
item.description: For the first time a group of international scientists have measured the impact of what happens to marine life when the lights go out underwater.

item.title: Search ends for 'very loved' Gold Coast fisherman Ash Haigh after almost five days lost at sea
item.description: Queensland Police has suspended the cross-border search for missing Gold Coast fisherman Ash Haigh after an extensive air and sea operation found no signs of life, with his sister describing him as a "very loved" family man.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lindsey Vonn hailed as 'idol' by downhill rivals after Milano Cortina crash

item.title: Jon Kudelka, Walkley-winning Tasmanian cartoonist, dies from brain cancer
item.description: Award-winning Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka dies after being diagnosed with brain cancer in 2024.

item.title: Christchurch terrorist gives testimony in NZ appeal court as he attempts to vacate guilty pleas over 2019 attack
item.description: The convicted Christchurch terrorist and murderer is giving testimony in the New Zealand Court of Appeal as he seeks to vacate his guilty pleas over his 2019 attack on two mosques.

item.title: Mitchell Freeway head-on crash in Butler leaves two dead after ute driven on wrong side of road
item.description: A 56-year-old-woman and a 24-year-old man are dead after a head-on collision involving a utility that was being driven on the wrong side of the Mitchell Freeway in Perth's north.

item.title: Rain brings relief and road closures after record heatwave in South Australia
item.description: High rainfall in north-eastern South Australia brings some relief for pastoralists after record-breaking heat, with a reprieve expected for metropolitan Adelaide this week.

item.description: Looking to add some more vegetarian dishes to your weekly rotation? We have you covered with these five recipes that are perfect for meat-free Mondays.

item.title: Queensland coroner hears father showed no concern for children caught in fatal house fire
item.description: An inquest has started probing a fatal house fire, with a coroner tasked with trying to determine what sparked it and whether either parent may have been involved.

item.title: Dimitri D'Elio, Kylie Stott jailed for Christmas Eve killing of Charlie Gander in Bunbartha, Victoria
item.description: Charlie Gander’s body was found in a burnt-out car on a country road on Christmas Eve, 2022. Today, two people were sentenced to a combined 36 years in prison over his death.

item.title: Family rallies to save pets left behind in Daly River flood evacuation
item.description: When hundreds of people evacuated the Daly River community due to flooding, most had to leave their pets behind. But a nearby family swung into action to help.

item.title: Ben Batterham receives payout from NSW government for wrongful prosecution
item.description: A Newcastle man will receive a confidential payout from the NSW government for wrongful prosecution by police for an alleged home invasion murder.

item.description: Billionaire chief executive says the company will shift its focus from Mars and the project could be achieved within 10 years.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos captain Adam Reynolds announces retirement at end of NRL season
item.description: Adam Reynolds will finish his stellar career at the end of the season after fulfilling his Broncos mission to perfection.

item.title: Palestine Action Group loses court challenge to extra police powers

item.title: New gun ownership laws announced by Queensland Premier David Crisafulli
item.description: The laws aim to crack down on rising gun crime and include tougher penalties for drive-by shootings.

item.title: Daly River expected to surpass major flood level before reaching peak
item.description: Flooding at the Daly River community is expected to surpass the major flood level late Monday, with a peak of 14.1 metres expected by Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: Heavy rain in central Australia causes celebration and concern
item.description: Rain across central Australia has been welcomed at cattle stations, but flooding and road damage have cut off some remote communities.

item.title: Crocodile wrangler Matt Wright fined $10k for landing helicopter in backyard
item.description: The Netflix star, who is currently behind bars on unrelated charges, pleaded guilty to a single count for landing his chopper and taking off in the backyard of his former home in Darwin's rural area.

item.title: Police and protesters clash in Sydney rally against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to Australia
item.description: Thousands of people attend protests across the country against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to Australia in the wake of the Bondi terror attack, with demonstrators in Sydney sprayed with pepper spray and led away in handcuffs.

item.title: Families of Laos methanol poisoning victims say they've been left in the dark on investigations
item.description: The families of Bianca Jones and Holly Morton-Bowles say they have been left in the dark following the 2024 poisoning deaths of their daughters.

item.title: ASIO was told about Bondi shooter's terrorist links years before attack, former spy claims
item.description: The former undercover agent spied on the Akrams when he infiltrated a Sydney IS terror cell for Australia's intelligence agency.

item.title: 'Massive' Indonesian ghost barge washes up on tiny Torres Strait island
item.description: The barge drifted into Australian waters from Indonesia after breaking from its moorings during bad weather.

item.title: Aussies Coady and Stalker miss the medals in big air final
item.description: Australian's Tess Coady and Mela Stalker miss the podium in the snowboard big air final, while Holly Harris and Jason Chan become the first Aussies in 12 years to represent the country in ice dancing.

item.title: Shaun Dunk asks to be 'locked up' 15 days before alleged stabbing murder, court hears
item.description: Fifteen days before he allegedly killed a woman and attempted to kill another, Shaun Michael Dunk asked to be taken into custody so he would not be a danger to anyone.

item.description: Announcement comes after a woman reveals her support person was prevented from entering the birth suite while she was in labour by Toowoomba Hospital security.

item.title: Commonwealth files defence against Linda Reynolds legal action in federal court
item.description: The Commonwealth files its defence against former senator Linda Reynolds, who is suing the government and its lawyers over a $2.4 million payout it made to Brittany Higgins.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Mitchell expected to batter the Gascoyne region as it moves inland
item.description: The system is expected to bring strong winds and heavy rain as it moves inland through the Gascoyne region.

item.title: US seizes tanker in Indian Ocean that fled Caribbean blockade
item.description: The Pentagon says the vessel was operating in breach of Donald Trump's orders on sanctioned ships in the region.

item.title: King stands ready to help police with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor investigation, palace says
item.description: Police have confirmed they are assessing information provided to them that former prince Andrew had passed late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein confidential reports while the former royal was British trade envoy more than a decade ago.

item.title: What happens when a medal is shared at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: In the men's team combined Alpine skiing event at the 2026 Winter Olympics, the Swiss and Austrian teams tied for silver. So what happens to the bronze medal? And when there was a tie for bronze in the men's ski jumping, was there a spare bronze?

item.title: Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka and the art of cutting through political spin
item.description: Hailed as an artist who "knew the power of comedy in holding truth to power", Jon Kudelka once described himself as "like a monkey with an automatic rifle".

item.title: Brisbane Broncos captain Adam Reynolds holds hope of Payne Haas contract backflip
item.description: Brisbane prop Payne Haas is set to arrive in England for the World Club Challenge where his teammates will try to convince him not to honour his deal with South Sydney.

item.title: Roblox on notice after 'disturbing' reports of child grooming
item.description: The government puts popular social gaming site Roblox on notice following media reports of children being approached and groomed by predators on the platform.

item.title: Painkillers and HRT therapies among drugs not being subsidised under PBS
item.description: Painkillers, HRT therapies and incontinence medicines are among the drugs that will not benefit from the new maximum $25 script price.

item.title: Shield and First Guardian collapses spur managed investment scheme crackdown
item.description: The federal government plans a crackdown on managed investment schemes following the collapses of Shield Master Fund and First Guardian.

item.title: How AI is disrupting the tech boom on global markets
item.description: Amongst tech investors the penny has finally dropped about just what the future may hold, and many are backing off or at least rethinking their strategy.

item.title: Cheryl Grimmer's family fights for new charges against suspect
item.description: NSW Parliament will again debate the 1970 disappearance of toddler Cheryl Grimmer, following claims her family's pleas for fresh charges against a suspect who confessed to murdering her when he was a teenager have been ignored.

item.title: Pakistan reverses cricket T20 World Cup boycott and will face India in Sri Lanka
item.description: Pakistan has ‍agreed to play India ​in the ⁠T20 World Cup match scheduled to take ‌place in Colombo this ‍Sunday, February 15.

item.title: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark was jailed but his community says legal issues persist
item.description: Former ATSIC leader Geoff Clark was jailed in 2024, yet some members of his community say legal issues linger on.

item.title: Man jailed for raping teenager under care of Department for Child Protection
item.description: A 33-year-old man has been jailed for more than eight years for raping a teenage girl who was in the care of South Australia's Department for Child Protection.

item.title: First national plan to address violence against Indigenous women and children
item.description: The first standalone national plan to tackle domestic violence against First Nations women and children was "hard fought for by Aboriginal women", an advocate says.

item.title: Native title holders take appeal over one of Australia's largest groundwater licences to High Court
item.description: The cultural value of water will be front and centre in the High Court in Canberra today as a group of native title holders from Central Australia fight to assert cultural rights over an aquifer under their lands.

item.title: Angus Taylor faces pressure to challenge for Liberal leadership
item.description: Liberal leadership aspirant Angus Taylor is facing pressure from conservative supporters to challenge Sussan Ley this week and end the damaging speculation paralysing the party.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell will only talk if Donald Trump grants clemency, lawyer says
item.description: The jailed accomplice of sex predator Jeffrey Epstein refuses to answer questions for the US Congress — but her lawyer says she will cooperate if granted clemency by the president.

item.title: States urged to sign National Water Agreement even though users unaware what's in final version
item.description: As the country's state governments and territories consider signing a new national water policy that seeks to address climate change and elevate First Nations knowledge, the agriculture industry fears it has been overlooked.

item.title: Premier fights back at police brutality claims as videos show violent clashes
item.description: Twenty-seven people were arrested, including 10 for assaulting police, on Monday night at a demonstration against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to Australia.

item.title: ASX loses ground and CSL boss steps down — as it happened
item.description: The ASX 200 closed slightly lower, and the CSL chief executive stepped down abruptly ahead of tomorrow's half-year results. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: McLaren unveils livery for MCL40 ahead of 2026 F1 season, Piastri and Norris excited about new challenge
item.description: McLaren has unveiled its livery for the 2026 Formula 1 championship season, retaining the design that helped it win championships in the previous two seasons.

item.title: Jake and Chris Waterman relishing prospect of AFL Origin as Perth prepares for Victorian invasion
item.description: WA's last State of Origin captain Chris Waterman is relishing the prospect of the concept's reboot — and can't wait to see his son Jake donning the famous black swan for the clash.

item.title: Turtles discovered in Dumaresq Dam could be dumped pets
item.description: The unexpected discovery of four turtle species in a dam near Armidale has left researchers wondering if people have been dumping unwanted pets.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce taps into rural anger as One Nation eyes Coalition seats at the Victorian election
item.description: The right-wing party's prized recruit, Barnaby Joyce, made a key appearance deep in National Party territory as the 2026 Victorian election campaign began to take shape, Richard Willingham writes.

item.title: Catherine O'Hara's cause of death revealed as pulmonary embolism
item.description: Award-winning actress Catherine O'Hara died from a pulmonary embolism, according to her death certificate.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn set for multiple surgeries but denies torn ACL contributed to Winter Olympic crash
item.description: American ski great Lindsey Vonn will "require multiple surgeries" after sustaining a tibia fracture, but denies that her previously ruptured ACL was the cause of the crash that ended her Winter Olympic Games.

item.title: AI-generated social media posts like a 'snake eating its own tail'
item.description: The age of AI is here and it's going to be infinitely useful, or so they tell us, unless you're the kind of person who, like me, finds computer-generated stories infinitely boring and an insult to humanity.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Milano Cortina organisers looking into broken medals after at least four incidents
item.description: Records are meant to be broken at the Olympics, but in the Milano Cortina Games, it is the medals being dismantled, and organisers are giving it "maximum attention".

item.title: Broken Hill artist exhibits in Japan after brush with J-pop star Fujii Kaze
item.description: When Broken Hill artist Jason McCarthur started receiving emails from Japan about his tote bags, he assumed they were a scam. But pretty soon he had sold out of the bags and it was all thanks to a J-pop star.

item.title: Licensed program to kill native animals 'weak' and 'outdated' inquiry told
item.description: Animal welfare groups are calling for a major overhaul into the system that allows native animals to be killed in NSW.

item.title: NT Child Deaths Review Committee disbanded by government, with concerns it will result in 'serious gaps'
item.description: The NT Children's Commissioner says the government's decision to scrap a committee tasked with examining all child deaths in the territory leaves "serious gaps".

item.title: Queensland government dismisses concerns about Fitzroy River as 2032 Brisbane Olympics venue
item.description: The future of rowing and canoeing events being held in a controversial central Queensland venue choice for the 2032 Brisbane Olympic and Paralympic Games is still being assessed by international bodies.

item.title: Man accused of manufacturing pipe bombs in Canberra pleads not guilty
item.description: The man accused of manufacturing 15 pipe bombs found along Canberra footpaths last month pleads not guilty in court.

item.title: NSW Police disrupt muslim men praying outside Sydney's Town Hall
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Steven Bradbury clips Jake Paul as Ukrainian pays tribute — quick hits from Milano Cortina day three
item.description: Steven Bradbury hits Jake Paul with a drive-by as he celebrates Jutta Leerdam's Olympic gold, while a Sydney-born Kiwi receives a special celebration. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Turnbull says Coalition too concerned with approval of Sky News audience
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 4, Tuesday, February 10
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Gold Coast's Mona Wiggins celebrates 105th birthday with game of lawn bowls
item.description: Mona Wiggins is showing no signs of slowing down, celebrating her 105th birthday on the bowling green.

item.title: Christchurch attacker was pleased when terrorism charge laid, court hears
item.description: A former lawyer for the Australian who murdered 51 people at two New Zealand mosques in 2019 tells a court the shooter "never wanted to defend the terrorism charge".

item.title: Commonwealth asks to meet Roblox following reports of child grooming. Here's what we know
item.description: Roblox has been called to an urgent meeting with the federal government in the wake of reports that children are being groomed by predators and exposed to sexually explicit material on the popular online gaming platform.

item.title: Huon Aquaculture confirms antibiotic use in salmon hatchery on River Derwent
item.description: There are calls for the public to be made aware of antibiotic use in Tasmania's freshwater hatcheries after Huon Aquaculture recently used oxytetracycline to treat diseased salmon without informing downstream users.

item.title: Exploitation claims have been levelled against cruise ship company Carnival. Here's what we know
item.description: A major cruise ship has been investigated by the maritime safety regulator for claims around poor working conditions. A spokesperson for The Carnival Cruise Line says it has "nothing to hide" and welcomes AMSA's oversight. Here's what we know so far.

item.title: Baldivis man Jason William Forbes jailed for planning to abduct and abuse child after buying child sex dolls
item.description: A Perth man who planned to abduct and abuse a child, having scoped out schools and childcare centres and researched restraint methods, is jailed for seven years. Warning: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Hundreds rally against police response to night of violent protest clashes in Sydney
item.description: Hundreds of protesters have gathered outside a police station in Sydney to criticise the force's response to Monday night's rally against the visit of Israeli President Isaac Herzog.

item.title: Chappell Roan no longer represented by talent agency led by Casey Wasserman
item.description: Pop star Chappell Roan says she is no longer represented by the talent agency led by Los Angeles 2028 Olympics chief Casey Wasserman, who has faced criticism for flirtatious email exchanges with convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell more than 20 years ago.

item.title: Deadline looms for Warren Tredrea to pay Nine's legal costs after failed appeal against unfair dismissal case
item.description: Former footballer Warren Tredrea has an imminent deadline to pay $149,000 to his former employer, Channel Nine, following a failed appeal against an unfair dismissal case.

item.title: Deadly light plane crash raises questions about adequacy of flight training system
item.description: When a young pilot crashed his aircraft he and his two passengers died, but there are questions as to why he was even flying after failing two exams.

item.title: Tocumwal arrest over child abuse material.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Man charged after police allegedly find more than 125,000 files of child abuse material
item.description: A man appears in court after police officers seize a mobile and laptop with allegedly more than 125,000 files of child abuse material.

item.title: At school, I was my brother's protector. But I needed more support
item.description: I was my brother's protector at school, but the education system could have done more to support us both.

item.title: Trial begins after Geoffrey McLean allegedly murdered and dumped in wheelie bin
item.description: Four people, including the victim's former partner, are standing trial in relation to the alleged murder of 55-year-old man Geoffrey McLean, whose remains were found in a wheelie bin in Adelaide's north in 2022. Warning: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Global Athlete accuses IOC of 'kowtowing' to Russia by including AIN athletes
item.description: Advocacy group Global Athlete has accused the IOC of enabling Russia by allowing 13 Russian and seven Belarusian athletes to compete at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Dry conditions, heat and high winds combine for another day of high fire danger in Victoria
item.description: Victoria's parched landscape has authorities concerned amid forecasts of another day of heat and gusty winds across the state.

item.title: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell, 13 others face court over alleged Camp Sovereignty protest camp attack
item.description: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell was among more than a dozen people to face a Melbourne court on Tuesday over the alleged attack at Camp Sovereignty near the city's CBD last August.

item.title: Shark filmed in deep Antarctic waters
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Elvis Presley 'unguarded' in unseen footage used in new Baz Luhrmann film
item.description: When director Baz Luhrmann and his team uncovered hours of previously unseen Elvis Presley recordings, Luhrmann abandoned his original plans, deciding to "get out of the way" and let Presley tell his own story.

item.title: Canberra man staged scene and lied to Triple Zero after murdering his partner, court documents reveal
item.description: New details have emerged about the murder of Canberra woman Tiffany Spence, as court documents show her partner staged the scene before calling Triple Zero.

item.title: Tahmoor Coal placed into administration as court hears creditor winding-up bid
item.description: Tahmoor Coal has been placed into voluntary administration just as the Supreme Court was set to hear a creditor's winding-up application.

item.title: CFMEU inquiry hears Labor leaders ignored 'repeated' industry warnings
item.description: Industry warnings about a controversial construction industry code were ignored by former Labor leaders, an inquiry into the CFMEU has heard.

item.title: Greens MP's interaction with NSW Police at Sydney protest
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Top barrister and charity boss Mark Philip Dennis dead after child abuse arrest
item.description: The 60-year-old was found dead at his Leichhardt unit in Sydney's inner west on Monday evening, NSW Police said in a statement.

item.title: As many as 209 jobs to go from Telstra AI joint venture with Accenture, moving roles to India
item.description: The Telstra joint venture said this move will "bring an enhanced experience" to its customers, but did not make clear how many jobs in the joint venture (JV) are set to be moved to India.

item.title: Live: Aussie Graham begins Winter Olympics moguls campaign
item.description: Olympic silver medallist Matt Graham — one of Australia's flag-bearers at the opening ceremony — will hit the slopes in the men's moguls qualification stage at the Milano Cortina Games. Follow live.

item.title: Former NT police officer James Kirstenfeldt sentenced on drink driving, weapons offences
item.description: A former Northern Territory police officer has been ordered to pay almost $5,000 in fines and undergo supervised treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder after drunkenly crashing his car outside his suburban Darwin home.

item.title: Police and protesters clash at Sydney rally
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Queensland police commissioner Steve Gollschewski set to retire
item.description: Queensland's top cop Steve Gollschewski is set to retire after almost 50 years in the service.

item.title: Health warnings about ultra-processed foods
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: WA police investigate possible tobacco wars link to fire at Kelmscott store
item.description: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch confirms officers from Taskforce Maverick, which investigates crime linked to the illicit tobacco and vape trade, are involved with the investigation.
